other_tests.findings: Histological examination revealed scattered foamy macrophages in the portal areas and within sinusoids. The storage cells were PAS positive and diastase resistant. Electron microscopy revealed storage inclusions in Kupffer and vascular endothelial cells.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Forty-four hours after infusion, a second percutaneous liver biopsy was performed. Gb3 in the liver sample obtained before infusion was 25 nmol/mg of protein; after infusion, the value decreased to 16 nmol/mg of protein (36% reduction).

other_tests.findings: Focal areas of myelin loss and interstitial fibrosis confirmed with luxol fast blue, PAS, and trichrome stains.
The patient tolerated the infusion of a-gal A without incident. No antibody to the enzyme was detected in the serum.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Postinfusion urine samples showed Gb3 levels of 1958 nmol/g of creatinine in the 24-hour preinfusion sample, which reduced to 640 nmol/g of creatinine in the 28-day postinfusion sample (67% reduction). No reduction was seen in the 24-hour or 7-day postinfusion specimens.
